name: Basic Technologies
description: The most basic building blocks of BattleMech technology. All the things you need to get a large metal behemoth on its feet.

name: Star-League Technologies
description: The height of the Star League saw several refinements and improvements become common-place across the Inner Sphere.

name: Industrial Equipment
description: Sometimes industrial equipment is pressed into service as improvised weaponary. Generally inferior to proper, purpose built weapons they are nevertheless a great crowd pleaser.

name: Shrapnel Pods
description: Single use pods filled with explosives and shrapnel provide effective countermeasures against nearby infantry and battlemech alike.

name: C3 Targeting Computers
description: A C3 Targeting network (consisting of one C3 Master and up to 3 C3 Slaves) may be used by to share targeting information between multiple mechs, greatly improving the effectiveness of long range fire. T

name: Improved C3 Computer
description: The Improved C3 Computer Network enables the same targeting information sharing as its counterpart, but eliminates the Master / Slave aspect of the design. This increases reliability by removing a single point of failure.

name: LB-X Autocannons
description: LB-X Autocannons enable the use of both normal slug munitions as well as other types such as cluster ammo

name: Davion Autocannons
description: Known for their auto-cannon technology, House Davion produces various autocannon designs that either reduce the weight or improve on the rate of fire

name: Ultra Autocannons
description: Ultra Autocannons improve on the basic design by doubling the rate of fire. However the design does suffer from a small risk of jamming

name: Rocket Launchers
description: A simple, lower tech approach to missile projectiles. It sacrifices guidance systems and complex loader systems to provide a lower cost approach to delivering firepower

name: ER Lasers
description: Extended range lasers improve the overall range of lasers, but generate considerably more heat. This technology grants access to the following equipment

name: Advanced Gauss
description: Several variations have been developed for the original Gauss rifle, allowing for flexibility when incorporating this technology into mechs.

name: Advanced Gyros
description: Upgrades to the basic gyroscope used to stabilise the mech provide alternatives that offer reduced weight, reduced space or enhanced reliability.

name: Streak SRMS
description: Through the use of improved guidance systems, the Streak system is able to ensure that all missiles in a given volley hit their intended target

name: Targeting Computer
description: A Targeting computer increases the accuracy of many direct-fire ballistic and energy weapons, and enables the firer to target specific locations upon the enemy mech.

name: Multi-Missile Launcher
description: The Multi-Missile Launcher improves the loading and firing mechanisms, allowing the launcher change between firing SRM or LRM munitions at will

name: Medium Range Missiles
description: Falling somewhere between SRMs and LRMs in terms of reach, MRMs trade out many of the advanced guidance systems used in the other technologies in favour of a significantly increased volume of dumb-fire rockets.

name: Machine Guns
description: There are multiple variants to the humble machine gun that either improve on firepower or reduce weight

name: Omnimechs
description: OmniMechs are a new, modular approach to building mechs that enables the weapons and equipment load-out to be adjusted. This technology grants access to order OmniMech designs.

name: Advanced PPCs
description: Providing lighter and heavier variations on the base design, these advanced options provide alternatives for long-range firepower to meet a variety of needs.

name: Snubnose PPC
description: The snub-nose PPC improves close range accuracy and overall reach at the expense of being able to deliver damage at longer ranges

name: Plasma Rifle
description: The plasma rifle fires a ball of burning plasma, inflicting both damage and heat upon its target

name: Advanced Ferro-Fibrous
description: This technology grants access to two new variants of ferro-fibrous armour that use different techniques to change the trade-off between weight and bulk.

name: Triple Strength Myomer
description: Triple Strength Myomer strands replace the standard Myomer used to build a BattleMechs 'muscles'. When cold, they have the same power and strength as the standard Myomer, however once heated up they considerably increase the strength of the mech, making it much more deadly in melee combat.

name: Improved JumpJets
description: While heavier and bulkier, these jumpjets are more power efficient, allowing more to be powered off of an engine of similar power.

name: Advanced Missiles
description: While the humble explosive warhead remains effective, missiles can be used to deliver a variety of alternative payloads.

name: Small Cockpit
description: The small cockpit was developed as a space-saving measure and provides more room to fit other systems into the head of a mech. However, the cramped nature of the cockpit does make it harder for the pilot to operate the mech.

name: Light Fusion
description: Light Fusion reactors reduce the overall weight of the mechs engine while increasing the bulk slightly. However, by not being as large as their extra-light brethren, they also retain some of the survivability advantages of simpler engine designs.

name: Advanced AC Ammunition
description: House Davion is responsible for developing a variety of improvements to the humble Auto-Cannon shell.

name: One-Shot Launchers
description: By removing all ammo feed mechanisms completely, Improved One-shot launchers are able to reduce their weight.

name: Stealth Armour
description: Combined with an ECM system, stealth armour interferes with many targetting and guidance systems, making the mech harder to hit.

name: I-Narc
description: The Improved Narc launcher adds a more effective beacon design and allows for the use of a more diverse set of beacon options

name: Sword
description: A sword that weighs several tons on its own can do quite a bit of damage

name: Bloodhound Probe
description: The Bloodhound probe is an enhanced cousin of the Beagle sensor probe suite, piercing cover at a longer range and effectively neutralising many stealth and ECM systems.

name: Boosted C3 System
description: The Boosted C3 System improves on the strength of the communication signal used between mechs, making it more resilient against enemy ECM systems.

name: Thunderbolt Missile Launcher
description: The Thunderbolt Missile Launcher uses many of the guidance and launch systems of standard LRM launchers, but launches a single larger missile with a more powerful payload in place of numerous smaller missiles fired by standard LRMS. This technology grants access to:

name: Solaris Gauss
description: Some experimental Gauss Rifle variants never really found home on the battlefield, but found a useful home in the Solaris Arenas. The Magshot is basically an up-sized battle-armour Gauss Rifle, and the Silver Bullet Gauss is a cluster variant of the standard Gauss Rifle (however, its ammo feed mechanisms and barrel design only allow it to fire cluster ammo. Normal slug munitions are not supported, which limited its battlefield utility). This technology grants access to:

name: PPC Capacitors
description: The PPC capacitor allows PPCs to be pre-charged, allowing the heat burden to be spread over a longer time period

name: X-Pulse Lasers
description: X-Pulse lasers increase the reach of standard pulse lasers but considerably increase the amount of waste heat they generate.

name: Variable Speed Pulse Lasers
description: Variable Speed Pulse lasers can adjust their firing rate and energy use, allowing them to be considerably more powerful at close range

name: Extended LRM Launchers
description: The Extended LRM launcher improves the reach of the existing LRM technologies, but further sacrifices short range effectiveness.

name: Enhanced LRM Launchers
description: The Enhanced LRM launcher halves the minimum range of the LRM missile system, allowing it to be more effective in close quarters at the expense of additional weight and bulk.

name: Angel ECM Suite
description: The Angel ECM suite is the more powerful cousin to the Guardian ECM.

name: Hyper-Velocity AutoCannon
description: The Hyper-Velocity AutoCannon improves on the reach standard AutoCannon, with the resulting firing mechanism creating a visually impressive amount of smoke. The increased power of the firing mechanism does, however, come with a slight risk of ammo detonation while firing

name: Battlemech Taser
description: The Battlemech Taser uses power from the firing mechs Fusion Engine to cripple or completely disable its target

name: Supercharger
description: The SuperCharger allows more power to be extracted from a fusion engine, allowing mechs to significantly increase their running speed. However, there are some risks associated with overdriving an engine in this manner, and damage to the engine may result if overused

name: Advanced Internal Structures
description: There are a variety of more exotic materials and techniques that can be applied to constructing a BattleMech chassis.

name: Laser Anti-Missile System
description: The Laser AMS is similar in function to the normal Anti-Missile System, but due to its use of energy weapons it is not constrained by ammo.

name: Torso Mounted Cockpit
description: By mounting the cockpit inside the torso, it is possible to give the pilot the protection of alot more armour. However, the pilot becomes more dependant on the mech's sensor systems to know what is happening, and on the life support systems to keep him cool closer to the engine. Such cockpits are often cramped, due to limited torso space, and a usable ejection system has yet to be designed.

name: Extra-Extra-Light Engines
description: Even bulkier than the Extra-Light engine, the XXL engine provides a considerable reduction in weight. However, it is a much less heat-efficient engine compared to the alternatives.

name: Improved Heavy Gauss
description: The Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle sacrifices some range and has increased bulk and weight, but offers an improved ballistic profile that enables it to deliver its full damage even at long ranges

name: Coolant Pods
description: Coolant pods provide a one-shot tool for drastically reducing the heat of a Mech

name: CASE II
description: Improving on the protective capabilities of CASE, the CASE II system is able to further reduce the consequences of a damaged ammo bin.

name: Museum Pieces
description: Old, obsolete techs are often hard to source as well, since suppliers only stock what they think they can sell.

name: Laser Reflective Armour
description: Laser Reflective armour provides considerably more protection against laser weapons, but is much more vulnerable to physical impacts

name: Reactive Armour
description: Reactive Armour is embedded with small micro-explosive charges that can be used to counteract explosive weapons. It is much more bulky than most other armour types, and carries a small risk of a chain reaction in the charges themselves.

name: Battlemech Har-Jel System
description: Har-Jel, commonly used in the hull sealing systems of Clan spacecraft, can also be used in BattleMechs to protect against hull breaches while in hostile environments

name: Compact Fusion
description: Smaller but heavier, the compact fusion engine frees up a considerable amount of space in the centre torso.

name: Apollo MRM Fire Control System
description: While using a different technique to the Artemis Fire Control Systems utilised by SRM and LRM launchers, the Apollo FCS serves a similar function to increase the accuracy of the unguided MRM launchers

name: Battlemech Turret
description: Turrets provide weapons with the ability to cover a complete 360° firing arc. This technology grants access to:

name: Actuator Enhancement System
description: Through a complex setup, the responsiveness and precision of the mechs actuators are signicifantly improved.

name: Chain Whip
description: For when you like your gladiatorial combat with giant metal behemoths.

name: Claws
description: Rarwly seen outside of Solaris matches, claws are a formidible melee weapon.

name: Flail
description: For when you like your gladiatorial combat with giant metal behemoths.

name: Lance
description: For when you like your gladiatorial combat with giant metal behemoths.

name: Mace
description: For when you like your gladiatorial combat with giant metal behemoths.

name: Shield
description: For when you like your gladiatorial combat with giant metal behemoths.

name: Spikes
description: Not just for decoration, spikes can also be useful in a melee.

name: Battlemech UMU
description: By replacing the jumpjets with impeller turbines, mechs can be outfitted to move much more effectively underwater

name: Aquatic Survival System
description: While bulky, the MechWarrior Aquatic Survival System protects the pilot from being drowned in the event of the head being breached while underwater.

name: Blue Shield Particle Field Damper
description: By using electromagnetic fields, the Blue Shield PFD system provides limited protection against Particle Projection Cannons.

name: Null Signature system
description: By using a combination of systems to mask a both the heat and electromagnetic signatures of a battlemech, the Null Signature system interferes with the ability of opposing sensor and targeting systems to effectively acquire it.

name: Void Signature System
description: The Void Signature system combines techniques used by the Null Signature systems and Chameleon Light Polarisation System to render a mech almost invisible. The system is at its most effective when used on a still or slow moving mech.

name: Chameleon Light Polarization System
description: By using a mimetic system to try to camouflage the mech with its surroundings, the Chameleon Light Polarization System makes mechs much harder to target.

name: Binary Lasers
description: The Binary Laser Cannon functions pairs two laser weapons together into a single unit, combining some common parts to reduce weight and bulk.

name: Bombast Laser
description: The bombast laser allows the firer to sacrifice some accuracy for more damage.

name: Experimental Missiles
description: Highly advanced missile technologies, not yet even out of the lab. For a more creative approach to destruction

name: Mech Sprayer
description: While most often used to spray water or foam to fight fires, other fluids can also be delivered using this handy delivery system.

name: Enhanced Flamers
description: Various improvements have been devised that significantly improve upon the basic flamer

name: Laser Insulators
description: For a little added space and weight, laser weapons can be insulated to reduce the heat they impart on the rest of the mech. However, this does come with the risk of damaging the weapon.

name: Chaff Pods
description: Chaff pods provide a useful tool for throwing off the guidance systems on some guided missiles.

name: C3 Remote Sensors
description: Remote sensor packs can be launched from mechs to provide an additional source of targeting data for a C3 network.

name: Vibroblades
description: By rapidly vibrating the edge at a high frequency, vibroblades become remarkably effective cutting weapons.

name: Clan Technologies
description: Not generally available

name: Hardened Armour
description: Hardened armour is considerably more resilient to damage, but the additional weight of the armour materials impairs the movements of the mech.

name: Drone OS
description: Remote control system for mechs.

name: Unallocated Items
description: Odds and ends that haven't had their own tech set up for them yet.
